entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 23 at 3:50PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...SNOW POSSIBLE ACROSS THE NORTHERN PANHANDLE... Confidence is increasing in the potential for accumulating snow across the northern panhandle late Tuesday night into Wednesday. entry.cap:areaDesc: City and Borough of Juneau; Eastern Chichagof Island; Glacier Bay; Haines Borough and Klukwan; Municipality of Skagway

entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 23 at 1:46PM AKDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Elevated Surf Along the Southern Seward Peninsula This Afternoon and Evening... ...Strong Low Moving to the Lower Yukon Delta Tuesday... entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 23 at 8:55PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Sanford affecting Seminole County. .The forecast point at Sanford is forecast to remain in Moderate Flood Stage through the next week with only a slow decline forecast. Interests along the river will continue to see moderate flood impacts.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 23 at 8:51PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Deland affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at Deland will remain within Major Flood stage through at least mid week as levels slowly decline towards Moderate Flood Stage. Interests along the river should expect these major flood impacts to continue, but a recession of river water leading to
entry.cap:areaDesc: Lake; Volusia

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 23 at 8:48PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Above Lake Harney affecting Seminole County. .The forecast point above Lake Harney at Geneva remains in Major Flood. entry.cap:areaDesc: Seminole

entry.title: Flood Warning issued October 23 at 8:47PM EDT until further notice by NWS
entry.summary: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Florida... St Johns River Near Astor affecting Volusia and Lake Counties. .The forecast point at Astor continues a slow decline, remaining within Moderate Flood Stage. entry.title: Special Weather Statement issued October 23 at 2:04PM EDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...Strong Winds Expected Monday Near Lake Superior... Southerly winds with gusts up to 40 mph, with an occasional gust up to 45 mph possible, are expected over the western and north central U.P. near Lake Superior Monday as a low-level jet moves through. Be sure to tie down any light and loose objects, as the strong winds could blow them away.

entry.title: Winter Weather Advisory issued October 23 at 2:26PM MDT until October 24 at 12:00PM MDT by NWS
entry.summary: .A strong low pressure system will bring accumulating snow to the area tonight into Monday. Snow amounts of generally 2 to 5 inches can be expected across portions of northeast Wyoming and the northern Black Hills, with some higher amounts to around 6 inches likely across favored higher elevations.
